intro: Hieracium rigidum subsp. friesii, commonly known as the rigid hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are stiff and hairy, with a distinctive yellowish-green color, and its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is often found in temperate climates and is considered a minor weed in some agricultural settings.
